00002 //! \file *********************************************************************
00003 //!
00004 //! \brief Virtual arm for impaired
00005 //!
00006 //! - Compiler:           IAR EWAVR and GNU GCC for AVR
00007 //! - Supported devices:  AT90USB1287, AT90USB1286, AT90USB647, AT90USB646
00008 //!
00009 //! \author               Bastian S. Solem
00010 //!                       Vegard Ã˜ye
00011 //!
00012 //! ***************************************************************************
00013 //!
00014 //! @mainpage Main Description
00015 //!
00016 //! @section intro License
00017 //! This software uses code written by Atmel Corporation. Use of that code is
00018 //! subject to Atmel's End User License Agreement, \ref lic_page.
00019 //! This license does not apply to sensors.c and sensors.h.
00020 //!
00021 //! @section install Description
00022 //! This embedded application source code illustrates how to implement a HID mouse application
00023 //! over the AT90USBKey controller, reading from resistive sensors connected to ports P1,
00024 //! P2, P4, P5, P6 and P7.
00025 //!
00026 //! @section arch Architecture
00027 //! As illustrated in the figure bellow, the application entry point is located is the main.c file.
00028 //! The main function first performs the initialization of a scheduler module and then runs it in an infinite loop.
00029 //! The scheduler is a simple infinite loop calling all its tasks defined in the conf_scheduler.h file.
00030 //! No real time schedule is performed, when a task ends, the scheduler calls the next task defined in
00031 //! the configuration file (conf_scheduler.h).
00032 //!
00033 //! The sample dual role application is based on two different tasks:
00034 //! - The usb_task  (usb_task.c associated source file), is the task performing the USB low level
00035 //! enumeration process in device mode.
00036 //! - The mouse task performs mouse events decoding and report construction to the USB host.
00037 //!
00038 //! The mouse task is contained in the files mouse_task.c and sensors.c. The latter contains
00039 //! all sensor code.
00040 //!
00041 //! \image html arch_full.gif
00042 //!
00043 //! ***************************************************************************
00044

00074 #include "config.h"
00075 #include "modules/scheduler/scheduler.h"
00076 #include "lib_mcu/wdt/wdt_drv.h"
00077 #include "lib_mcu/power/power_drv.h"
00078 
00079 //_____ M A C R O S ________________________________________________________
00080 
00081 //_____ D E F I N I T I O N S ______________________________________________
00082 
00083 int main(void)
00084 {
00085    wdtdrv_disable();
00086    Clear_prescaler();
00087    scheduler();
00088    return 0;
00089 }
00090 
00091 //! \name Procedure to speed up the startup code
00092 //! This one increment the CPU clock before RAM initialisation
00093 //! @{
00094 #ifdef  __GNUC__
00095 // Locate low level init function before RAM init (init3 section)
00096 // and remove std prologue/epilogue
00097 char __low_level_init(void) __attribute__ ((section (".init3"),naked));
00098 #endif
00099 
00100 #ifdef __cplusplus
00101 extern "C" {
00102 #endif
00103 char __low_level_init()
00104 {
00105   Clear_prescaler();
00106   return 1;
00107 }
00108 #ifdef __cplusplus
00109 }
00110 #endif
00111 //! @}
